intro: Desmochaeta patula, commonly known as the slender marsh orchid, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to wetland and marsh habitats in North America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, thriving in environments with consistent humidity. Its rhizomes allow it to spread vegetatively, forming dense colonies in suitable conditions. Desmochaeta patula plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
